comments.body: A small build being stored could be siiick

I don't really understand or agree with the buildings and mobs inside bit, but the idea of being able to add shulker boxes to minecarts is good.

The main function I can think of using this for is refilling a shulker box, lets use a redstone filled shulker box as an example;

1. Combine the box with a minecart
2. Place minecart on a rail with hoppers above the rail
3. Minecart travels back and forth under the line of hoppers containing redstone components.
4. Shulker box is restocked by the variety of different components in said hoppers.
5. Once done the minecart and shulker box are dropped as separate items and shulker box is restocked.
6. Profit?

That's just one of many applications this could possible be used for, we don't need additional features, the fact that shulker boxes retain inventory when dropped is already powerful enough.
@F1R3FLYY OG Honestly, I agree, a few months after posting it doesn't seem very true to the vanilla game. I guess I got feature hungry.
I personally would like to see the ability to dispense a full shulker box into a minecart rather than needing to craft it although they aren't mutually exclusive.
I like this, except I think it should keep the shulker box in the minecart. Like a chest minecart, but it keeps it's items.

I was just thinking this would be a great tool, because the main point of moving storage is to move it, outside of your inventory. This provides a better tool than the Minecart with Chest, because upon breaking, you don't have a ton of items spilled all over the ground. Transporting shulkers could even be easier. Dispense a Shulker onto a Minecart to turn it into a Minecart with Shulker, which gets sent over track to destination, where it gets dumped off. Much more server-friendly than a hopper line.
The main difference between a Chest Minecart, besides dropping a shulker box instead of items, could be that the shulker boxes could be put in/out of the minecart without destroying the minecart

I think with the recent update, it might be cool if the shulkerbox minecart, when destroyed, gives back a shulkerbox minecart with all the item inside. The only way to get those items out is by a player taking it out or a hopper minecart. Might be useful in farms.

i agree that this should exist -- im working on a mailing system and my plan would be significantly easier if i could use shulkers in minecarts.

but i think the 2nd part should only be do-able with dispensers, not just dropping it at the minecart, yknow?
This would be cool
I wanted this to be in the game for a while

I would like to see a Hay feeder thich could be placed in the forest and would lure mobs like deer (if in Minecraft). They are common in European wood where Woodsmen give extra food to wildlife during winters and harsh weather (extra dry seasons) whilst it helps them count them up.

they also add Salt Stones for licking (as salt is essential for survival).
It should be possible to throw food to animals from a dispenser and them eat it and breed, just like villagers do with bread
Grass feeder will be awesome to make sheep great again (grow wol)!
Like the idea ALOT

An animal Feeder that you could hook to a hopper that when you put in "food" (hay ect) it gives a chance to let the animals reproduce it would cut down on the pains of trying o individually feed because it's hard to keep track when they hay is in your hand and they are all trying to get it at once
Either this, or make the wooden stairs' crafting recipe give you 6 stairs when you craft it.

Yes.

I wanted to post something on this and to expand on this, I would also propose a Carpenter Villager and the Carpenter would make wood items. During the 'work' hours, they would wander around the village and detect changes made to the village structures, like if a building was griefed and if there is missing blocks, they replace them.

They would do that with the AI being able to see what the schematic is and go through each block of the schematic.

It doesn't worry about additions, but worries about blocks that were replaced from the original. The villager cannot break blocks, only place blocks and if the villager cannot access the block, like if it were obstructed by another block, or didn't have an air block on any side of it, there would be storm clouds around the villager to let the player know something is wrong.

For blocks that are out of reach, like on the roof, the villager can still 'access' it from the ground, it wouldn't need a ladder. As long as there is an air block around it, the correct block will reappear in it's position. 

As a secondary job, when there are no repairs to be made, or if the villager cannot find any repairs to be made, they make fences and build defenses around the village.
It does that by the AI being able to see the bounding box around the village and places fence around a barrier around the bounding box accordingly, but it does not build in areas the AI sees as a hazard and does not build around areas with lava so the fence will not burn.
Yes.
You could build this by adding dye to a red stone lamp
good job! you just saved my life and other people!

What if you could craft a platinum apple with an enchanted apple at the center with eight platinum ingots surrounding it. The platinum apple will give you these effects: regeneration, resistance, absorption, fire resistance, conduit power, invisibility and strength for ten seconds.
Excellent idea
I can think of pranking ideas with it
A nice idea that will make playing in nether fortresses a little easier.

I play Bedrock version, and I feel braziers need to be a similar size to cauldrons with lava inside, otherwise it's just a new type of lantern, which we now already have 2 of. Besides, Java players don't have the option to have Cauldrons with lava as a light source, so adding this to the game would be good.
Woah! They look great.

It would be intresting if they could be turned on or off by interacting with it somehow, also charcoal is used in real life braziers, so the blazier should consume charcoal giving some kind of item like a fire charge most of the time, or a completely new item on occasion.

I think this block could have so much potential beyond a nether fortress lighting block, that would really work. If this concept is added in some way, if it became used in some kind or pyromancy based feature, that would probably give it a use for players who don't use nether themed building often, and encouraging people to build in that theme.
Maybe even mobs extinct from the minecraft world like mammoths or dinosaur bones

Maybe glacier and ice spikes biomes could house these. Large ravines made up entirely of ice could be found closer to the center of colder biomes. Some of the ice could hold fossil structures, similar to those found under deserts and swamplands.
No. Too op.
Any way to get an easy way of flight is too op.

@blast burner not entirely true. Mind you I said 6 feathers + a hard to acquire item, such as a nether star.

If you ever played terraria it isn't an incredible advantage either. Especially if more ranged mobs are added or flying ones.

 

Speaking of Terraria they have it so you only could fly so much before gliding down, making it so you have to land on something before flying again. It could only allow say; 20 blocks of height before forcing you to glide down to the ground before flying again.
We already have this in the form of the Elytra wings

Elytra don't work the way I suggested, and it creates diversity in flying items. 

In terraria there is a cloud item for jumping, a hook to fling towards walls, jet boots to fly, and wings to fly in a different way.
oi
Make it so they can only work with power and power means blocks of Redstone for temporary flight and a nether star for more speed plus can't run out and Dragon egg for even faster flight
I honestly agree

I like this idea. I also posted about onion plants but I didn't think of using Alliums for them! This is a great idea! If you want to see my post about onions then here is the link: Onion plants ‚Äì Minecraft Feedback
it should be called a wild onion.

Reading the comment that says that it should be call a wild onion gave me an idea. What if there are two types of onion plants, the first one is a "Wild Onion" grown using alliums, and the other would be a "Tamed Onion" or just an "Onion" found/grown either by planting seed-like things you get from harvesting a Wild Onion, or possibly found in Villages. That would make it so that it would be harder to get Wild Onions because you have to plant alliums to get them, rather than the seed-like things you get from harvesting the onions. Making it so that Wild Onions would probably be slightly better than the "Tamed Onion."
There shouldn't be any placement limit. I want to hang them from walls too

You posted this, and now if you google something along the lines of "Can you get a jungle map in minecraft?" this comes up. It looks like it is an actual thing that exists on the google page. But i think this should be in the game, good idea!
I don't like the idea, sorry. Food spoilage is a huge nerf with no added benefit.

I feel like this is adding more complication to the game with no real added fun.

I could see maybe having a freezer that you use a water bucket on and get a block of packed or blue ice in return though.

I had made a huge in depth post on food spoilage and temperature as an addition to the difficulty level but they didn't approve it, not once but twice. I love the idea, food can be salted or frozen, with an ice box, like a double chest but vertical running on a block of ice - blue ice, yada-yada. I'm surprised this got posted...
Love this idea because I had the same idea!! It adds more complexity to the game rather then just storing food and eating.

I think this is a really good idea because it could act like a chest, like one could be call a freezer, but if you added another on top it would be like a double chest but open like a fridge, and it would store food.

This block could also be a precursor for frozen treats such as Ice Cream or Popsicles. Craft Ice Cream with a bucket of milk and sugar, and maybe even add more flavors later. Craft a Popsicle with sweet berries and sugar. Ice Cream and Popsicles are not frozen until put into the Ice Chest, so maybe start with Ice Cream Custard, or something like that, and Juice for Popsicles.
it can be create with a chest and 8 ice blocks
Like inkycatz has said, ‚ÄúITS HARD TO READ IN ALL CAPS‚Äù.
Yes, please remove the all caps. As for your idea, sunglasses are too modern for Minecraft. Go play modded Minecraft for that.
plus, different players have there eyes at different spots
It doesn't seem very practical.
If you want sunglasses, why you don't edit your skin to have sunglasses?
This is really cool.  I love the idea of having a passive flower farm.

I'm just wanting to give Bats something to do, and this sounds cute.

I realize that one could just do a Redstone farm for flowers, but the Bat House could have its uses.

Bat houses are usually thin, to appear as if it's a spot underneath bark to live.  Minecraft could save the stripped bark of a log and use that in the crafting recipe.

I'd also love to see this paired with some Bat Variants (Black, Brown, White with a yellow nose) ... it would make it really interesting.

 

Additionally, and this is a big part of my idea, it would give bats a more positive role.  Bats are often seen as disgusting creatures, evil creatures, scary, etc ... and in Minecraft they are seen as background noise.  Something to smirk at when it catches on fire from lava.

 

A bat house would teach children the values of bats, flowers, etc.  And make them less afraid of bats.

Another thought:  When you run through the Bat House's area of effect at night (when the bats are out), there is a chance the bats will land on your shoulders! 

They're just saying Hi.  They leave when you exit the area.  They aren't adventurers like Parrots are.  ;)

Hello,

This is Mark Abernathy.  Creator of the post.  I'm not able to log into my original account for the time being, but I wanted to come on and make comments.

 

I'm thinking the Bat-in-a-Bottle is a bit inhumane and silly.  Since Bees can be leashed, perhaps just leasing the Bat and then bringing it to the Bat House could work.  :)  Bunch of bees on leads is adorable.  The same could easily be said for the bats.
Love the idea! They're also good with fertilization though so they should help with growth of crops as well!

Could simply be a block of rotten flesh that would be slightly gooey like a honey or slime block but instamined. Give some utility to rotten flesh to allow you to creat easy to break doors and barriers in early game or just a good temp building block.
Can also be used in log cabins or columns or floor boards.
Why the netherstar?
I am sorry but this is a horrible idea.
There would have to be a drawback. Like on land it makes you suffocate while wearing it
this would be cool but I think that if you wore it then you would need to wear a scuba suit made from a rotten flesh but repaired and a trident with riptide equipped

Beds SHOULD be able to be made from feathers as well as wool, whether it converts to wool when made into blocks or not.  If you are chicken farmer you get a massive amount of feathers with nothing to do with them!  And a way to condense and store them is greatly needed!
Feather Blocks are very much needed in game! Feathers definitely need more use!
As it is, the pale oak leaves stick out like a sore thumb when brought to a new biome. This needs to happen!

In my opinion, it would be very interesting if the Pale Oak leaves remained white even outside the Pale Garden biome (similarly to the cherry tree leaves that always remain pink).
There are already many green leaf blocks in the game and for a builder it would be much more useful and interesting to have different colored leaf blocks available.
The best way to make this change would be to make the Pale Oak leaves always the color they currently have only in its Pale Garden biome and exactly like the cherry tree and azalea leaves they should not change color when changing biomes.
